Description: Lower body and conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly early patterned or Wild Goat Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with reserved dot at centre; exterior: bowl and top of foot reserved, glazed streaky black (fired reddish) below; inscription on reserved underside.
Curator's comments: The number in Petrie's catalogue, '65', is written in pen on the underside of the foot.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 65)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 32)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0302) (phase 2)
